body.p: What is the main difference between the kMeans Clustering Technique and the kNN Problem technique:

multiple_choice.choice: kNN can perform best with data (in the same dataset) that is not of the same scale but kMeans can not perform well when data is not scaled.
kNN involves labeled data used to train a model and kMeans clustering will cluster data points to identify previously unknown patterns.
kNN is an eager learner and kMeans clustering is a lazy learner.

feedback.p: Incorrect: KMeans can perform well with data that is not of the same scale unlike KNN.
Correct: KNN is a supervised regression or classification technique and KMeans is an unsupervised learning technique.
Incorrect: The reverse is the case. KNN is a lazy learner and KMeans is an eager learner.

body.p: Why is KMeans Clustering Technique considered an Eager Learner:

multiple_choice.choice: It is slow to train but fast to learn and it requires less space during training.
It requires more space during training since it does not have labeled data for training.
Once dataset is received, it is stored prior to learning and begins to cluster the data and this learns very quickly.

feedback.p: Correct: These are the characteristics of an eager learning method. Decision trees are also examples of eager learners.
Incorrect: This is the characteristic of a lazy learner. The advantage of eager learning is that it requires less space during training even while it is a slow learner.
Incorrect: Lazy learners store datasets and takes less time learning and more time training.
